snippet: A children’s advocacy group found that most New York City charter schools have disciplinary codes that do not meet either state or federal requirements.
abstract: Advocates for Children releases report finding that majority of New York City charter schools have disciplinary codes that fail to meet both state and federal requirements; cites high suspension and expulsion rates, lack of special rules regarding children with disabilities, and instances of suspension and expulsion without hearings.
lead_paragraph: A children’s advocacy group found that most New York City charter schools have disciplinary codes that do not meet either state or federal requirements.

headline.main: Report Faults Charter School Rules on Discipline of Students
headline.print_headline: Report Faults Charter Rules on Discipline of Students
